newsitem.title: UK: IRA Belfast van contained 1,000 lbs of explosives.
newsitem.headline: IRA Belfast van contained 1,000 lbs of explosives.

text.p: A van abandoned by the Irish Republican Army near a Belfast hotel contained 1,000 lbs (450 kg) of explosives, police said on Thursday.

British security forces late on Tuesday sealed off parkland around Belfast Castle, a 19th century former private mansion packed with revellers, as bomb disposal officers tried to establish if the vehicle contained explosives.
Police said they discovered other bomb-making equipment in the vehicle apart from the home-made explosives.
"It contained about 1,000 lbs of explosives in two bins, also detonating cord and other bomb-making equipment," a police spokesman said.
Police said a man using an IRA identity codeword had telephoned the media late on Tuesday saying there was a landmine in the vehicle.
He said the group had dumped the vehicle in the grounds of Belfast Castle after encountering high-level British counter-guerrilla activity.
